intro: Cyanea superba var. velutina, commonly known as the velvet hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is characterized by its velvety, dark green foliage and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is known for its ornamental value. The varietal name 'velutina' refers to the soft, velvety texture of its leaves.
